message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CY. 

This paper deals with the analysis of social media data, specifically Sina Weibo and Chinese language Twitter, and proposes an algorithm for topic detection. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper involves natural language processing techniques for topic detection, which suggests it could also belong to the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). The study also focuses on the differences in social attention on the two platforms, which could fall under the sub-category of Social and Behavioral Sciences (cs.SOC). The paper also involves clustering and comparison of topics, which could be related to Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Cybersecurity (cs.CY).
